data.content:
noun
[noncount] a children's game in which players walk around a row of chairs while music plays and try to sit down when the music stops
In musical chairs the number of chairs is always one less than the number of players, and the player who is not fast enough to find a chair when the music stops has to leave the game.
a situation in which many changes happen in a way that is confusing or harmful
The changes in the administration amounted to a game of musical chairs.

Danh từ
trò chơi giành ghế theo nhạc
